intro: Osmorhiza bipatriata, commonly known as the twin-country boneset, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hollow, ribbed stems and fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Osmorhiza bipatriata is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine.
